title: [Large-Scale] Continuous Medical Education Design to Address Gaps in Depression Treatment

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic depression diagnosis and treatment protocols, experience with chronic disease management models
context.additional_context: A digital-based education program for medical professionals, with practice-centered design considering applicability in actual clinical settings

learning_goals: Learners can use a tool analyzing depression treatment gaps to propose three or more customized intervention strategies reflecting the target group's specificities (ethnicity/race, etc.).

Learners successfully complete simulations applying the six core elements of the chronic disease management model (self-management support, clinical information systems, etc.) to depression treatment two or more times.

Learners analyze two real depression case studies within 3 months, draft treatment improvement plans per a project-based assessment rubric (4 criteria: goal-setting, intervention strategies, implementation plans, evaluation methods), and share them on digital platforms (Notion/Google Docs) to receive â‰¥3 feedbacks from peers/experts.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
